com.percussion.extension
Interface IPSExtensionDef

public interface IPSExtensionDef

An IPSExtensionDef defines an extension and its deployment settings, including the URLs of all its resources. The actual contents of the resources are specified elsewhere.

This interface may be extended to support particular kinds of extension definitions.

The extension version.

Constant Field Values

INIT_PARAM_FACTORY

static final String INIT_PARAM_FACTORY
The full classname of the factory that should be used to serialize and deserialize this def. This is for future extensibility.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

INIT_PARAM_REENTRANT

static final String INIT_PARAM_REENTRANT
"yes" or "no" depending on whether this extension is reentrant. This is used by the server. The default value is "no". The initial version only supports re-entrant extensions.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

INIT_PARAM_SCRIPTABLE

static final String INIT_PARAM_SCRIPTABLE
This is provided so all users will use this property consistently. "yes" or "no" depending on whether this extension is scriptable. The server does not use this property.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

INIT_PARAM_DESCRIPTION

static final String INIT_PARAM_DESCRIPTION
This is provided so all users will use this property consistently. The human-readable, freeform description of this extension. The server does not use this property.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

INIT_PARAM_ASSEMBLY_FILE_SUFFIX

static final String INIT_PARAM_ASSEMBLY_FILE_SUFFIX
Usually file name extension of template source for given assembler. If specified then template editor adds this suffix when generating file name it uses to discover editor for this source. If not specified no editor will be displayed. Sample values: ".txt", ".xml".

See Also:
Constant Field Values

INIT_PARAM_ASSEMBLY_AUTO_RELOAD

static final String INIT_PARAM_ASSEMBLY_AUTO_RELOAD
Controls the loading of velocity macros. yes means that the velocity engine is told to reload on change. sys_reinit=true may need to be used anyway.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

INIT_PARAM_ASSEMBLY_LIBRARIES

static final String INIT_PARAM_ASSEMBLY_LIBRARIES
A comma delimited list of "library" velocity macro files to load from the library locations.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

INIT_PARAM_SCRIPT_BODY

static final String INIT_PARAM_SCRIPT_BODY
The the javascript script body.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Method Detail

getRef

PSExtensionRef getRef()
Returns the extension reference containing the fully qualified name of this extension.

Returns:
The extension reference. Never null.

getInterfaces

Iterator getInterfaces()
Returns the fully qualified names of the known extension interfaces implemented by this extension. These interfaces help to define where instances of this extension may be used (for example, is this a JDBC driver, a password filter, a result document processor, or some combination of the three?).

Returns:
An Iterator over one or more non-null Strings. Never null.

implementsInterface

boolean implementsInterface(String iface)
Compares the supplied interface name against the interfaces supported by this extension and returns the result.

Parameters:
iface - The fully qualified name of the interface to check.
Returns:
true if the supplied interface is supported by this extension, false otherwise.

getInitParameterNames

Iterator getInitParameterNames()
Returns the names of the initialization parameters. Initialization parameters will be passed to the extension (via an extension-specific mechanism) when the extension is first initialized. All parameters beginning with "com.percussion.extension" are used by the extension subsystem. No user defined params should begin with this suffix. The order of parameters is unspecified and should not be taken to mean anything.

Returns:
An Iterator over zero or more non-null Strings. Never null.

getInitParameter

String getInitParameter(String name)
Returns a String containing the value of the named initialization parameter of the extension, or null if the parameter does not exist. All parameters beginning with "com.percussion.extension" are used by the extension subsystem. No user defined params should begin with this suffix.

Parameters:
name - The parameter name. Must not be null.
Returns:
The value of the named parameter, or null if it does not exist. This method will never return null when called with a String value from the parameter name iteration.
See Also:
getInitParameterNames()

getRuntimeParameterNames

Iterator getRuntimeParameterNames()
Gets the names of all runtime parameters required by this extension. These runtime parameters must be bound (in the returned order) to the extension instance at runtime (usually the caller of the extension is responsible for doing the binding).

Returns:
An Iterator over zero or more non-null String param names. The order of the parameter names is important and should be preserved.

getRuntimeParameter

IPSExtensionParamDef getRuntimeParameter(String name)
Gets the parameter definition for the named runtime parameter, or null if no parameter by that name is used.

Parameters:
name - The param name. Must not be null.
Returns:
The parameter definition, or null.

getResourceLocations

Iterator getResourceLocations()
Returns the locations of all resources required by the defined extension. This includes any files which make up the extension itself (such as Java .class or .jar files, native executables and libraries, and images and .properties files).

Note: Depending on the type of extension defined, not all resources need to be specified explicitly. For instance, some unspecified resources may be contained within resources which are explicitly specified (such as files and subdirectories which are contained within an explicitly specified directory, or Java .class files which are contained within an explicitly specified .jar file, and so on).

In the current version of the product, each resource location must be a relative file: URL whose parent directory will be determined at runtime by the extension handler.

In future versions, some extensions may be allowed to use absolute file: URLs and/or other protocols (such as http). Handler implementations should verify that they understand the locations of each specified resource before installing the extension.

Returns:
An Iterator over zero or more non-null URLs. Never null.

getSuppliedResources

Iterator getSuppliedResources()
Returns the list of URL objects that point to the files supplied with this def when it was installed or last updated.

Returns:
An Iterator over zero or more URL objects. May be null if this def does not contain such a list (backward compatibility.

setSuppliedResources

void setSuppliedResources(Iterator resources)
Sets the list of supplied resource files installed with this extension so their names and locations will be saved with this definition.

Parameters:
resources - A non-null but possibly empty Iterator of URL objects.

setDeprecated

void setDeprecated(boolean isDeprecated)
Sets whether or not this extension has been deprecated.

Parameters:
isDeprecated - If true, then this extension is flagged as having been deprecated. If false, then this extension is not deprecated.

isDeprecated

boolean isDeprecated()
Determines if this extension has been deprecated.

Returns:
true if this extension has been deprecated, false if not.

isRestoreRequestParamsOnError

boolean isRestoreRequestParamsOnError()
Returns:
true indicates that if this extension call is followed by an error condition then the request parameters modified by this extension should be explicitly restored by calling PSRequest.restoreParams(), false otherwise.

setRequiredApplications

void setRequiredApplications(Iterator apps)
Sets the list of the applications required by the implementation of this extension.

Parameters:
apps - An iterator over zero or more application names as String objects, may not be null.

getRequiredApplications

Iterator getRequiredApplications()
Get the list of required applications. See setRequiredApplications(Iterator) of more info.

Returns:
An iterator over zero or more application names as String objects, never null.

isJexlExtension

boolean isJexlExtension()
Is this extension based on the java expression language (JEXL)?

Returns:
true if it is, false otherwise.

addExtensionMethod

void addExtensionMethod(com.percussion.extension.PSExtensionMethod method)
Add the supplied extion method.

Parameters:
method - the new method to add, not null. If a method with the same name already exists, it will be overridden. Otherwise the new method is added.

getMethods

Iterator<com.percussion.extension.PSExtensionMethod> getMethods()
Get all extension methods.

Returns:
all extension methods, never null, may be empty.

removeExtensionMethod

void removeExtensionMethod(String name)
Removes the identified extension method.

Parameters:
name - the name or the extension method to be removed, not null or empty. Does nothing if no method exists for the supplied name.

clone

IPSExtensionDef clone()
Clone this instance.

Returns:
a clone of this instance, never null.

getVersion

int getVersion()
Returns an integer form of the "rhythmyx.extension.version" init property. If the property is not specified or invalid, it will return 1 (one).

Returns:
A positive int representing the extension version.
